p: Pyrimidinamine has great importance as it is widely spread in living organisms and also a broad spectrum of biological activities such as antitumor properties [ 1, 2], herbicidal [ 3], fungicidal [ 4], antidepressant [ 5], and also, amino pyrimidine was an indicator of antitumor [ 6], antibacterial [ 7], and antiviral [ 8] activities. The biological importance of natural and synthetic 2-pyrimidinamine core derivatives are shown in Figure 1, such as alkaloidal (divicine) properties found in fava beans, the aglycone of vicine [ 9], the cytotoxic activity of alkaloid marine sponge (bromohymenialdisine) [ 10], and antifeedant of alkaloid (dibromoisophakellin) [ 11].
